head.supplied: Botanic Gardens ¶ June 6th 1867 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to solicit that you will be pleased to sanction the expenditure of the undermentioned sums, available out of the Votes for the current year ...

div.p: O67/7029, unit 750, VPRS 44 inward registered and unregistered correspondence, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS written by Ernst Heyne and signed by M. Botanic Gardens

I have the honor to solicit that you will be pleased to sanction the expenditure of the undermentioned sums, available out of the Votes for the current year for this establishment and place them at my disposal for disbursement.

div.p:
The honorable the President of the Board of Land & Works
M's letter was read by the Assistant Commissioner of Crown Lands and Survey, C. Hodgkinson, who minuted on 15 June 1867: 'Mr Agg to submit this application for consideration of the Honble The Commr of Lands & Survey'. Grant was the Commissioner of Crown Lands and Survey as well as the President of the Board of Land and Works.
